programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ is pretending to be a great detective, and needs a mystery to solve! A case quickly comes his way when something nibbles on one of Baby Bops healthy snacks. BJ, Barney, and Baby Bop uncover several clues along the way and soon realize the culprit is someones pet rabbit. Barney sees Riff protecting a nest full of duck eggs. Together, they leave the eggs to look for food for when the ducklings hatch. When they return, Riff is pleasantly surprised to find the eggs have cracked open and the baby ducklings have hatched!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: While playing in the caboose, BJ is surprised to learn that The Land of Mother Goose truly exists. Several Mother Goose characters have come to ask for help; parts of their rhymes are missing! Mother Goose arrives and fixes the problem, and all of the Mother Goose characters return home. BJ and Baby Bop hope to visit them soon. When Baby Bop catches Barney, BJ, Riff and some children wrapping a mysterious present in the caboose, she just cant wait to see what is in the box. Barney suggests they listen to a story while they wait. Baby Bop finally gets to open her present and realizes that sometimes waiting is a good thing!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop isnt satisfied with the things she can do. She wants to play the keyboard like Riff and wants to be able to skate like Barney. Nobody can cheer her up, until she unexpectedly gets the whole park dancing and she realizes there are things she can do, too! When a wheelchair-bound child is unintentionally neglected by his friends, Barney steps in to help. He gently reminds the others to include the child by showing them that even Barney feels excluded sometimes. It isnt always easy being a big, purple dinosaur. In the end, everyone is included for a day of fun!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Jamal has never danced before and is too shy to try. On the day of the big dance party in the park, Barney and his friends introduce Jamal to many kinds of dance. Barney assures Jamal that he can do anything he puts his mind to even dance. With Barneys help, Jamal finally finds his groove and has fun dancing with his friends! Barney tells Baby Bop the story of The Princess Without a Song to Sing. In this original fairytale, Baby Bop imagines herself as the sad little princess trying to find her unique song. Barney, BJ and Riff all become characters in the story, each sharing their songs and revealing an element of song, sound, rhythm and feeling. With their help, the princess finds her song and is delighted to sing it for her friends!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Riff cant find his drumsticks anywhere. He knows he had them when he visited various neighborhood locations with Barney earlier in the day. Barney magically recreates neighborhood spots to help refresh Riffs memory. Happily, Barneys strategy is a success and Riff finds his drumsticks. Along the way, everyone learns that the most important part of a neighborhood is the people who live there! Barney helps Baby Bop explore many different jobs. At the end of the day, Baby Bop has several different careers to consider for when she grows up. But for now, shes happy just being three!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ is waiting for a very special letter from his pen pal in China. The letter reveals that his pen pal is coming for a visit. With the help of friends in the park, BJ hurries to get the park ready. He wants it decorated so his pen pal feels right at home. BJ soon learns that his pen pal wants to see how BJ really lives! Everyone is anxiously awaiting Mrs. Matumas Harambee Dance Troupe to arrive. They finally arrive and perform a show of African music and dance and everyone pulls together in the true spirit of Harambee!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney is snacking on pistachios...and just can't seem to stop! His friends try to help. An unexpected avalanche of pistachios convinces Barney that his friends may be right. BJ is looking to find players for his baseball team. When his baseball-impaired cousin Riff asks to play, BJ is faced with a difficult choice. Barney helps BJ discover the meaning of team sports, friendships, and winning.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: In her eagerness to play with her friends, Baby Bop forgets to say please and thank you. Barney tells her that these two words can be magic. Baby Bop daydreams she can't say the magic words, no matter how hard she tries! Then Riff invents a robot to clean up the park. When Riff's Litterbot malfunctions, it creates even more trash to clean up.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney has a tee-rific surprise for BJ and Baby Bop. Cousin Riff is moving to town! Riff amazes everyone with his awesome musical abilities. When Barney suggests that they put on a show, Riff becomes shy - he's never performed in a show before. With encouragement from Barney, Riff joins in and does what he knows best - making music!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ brings his brand-new toy plane to the park. Riff borrows the plane while BJ is off playing. Unfortunately, curiosity gets the best of Riff and he ends up taking the plane apart to see how it works. Luckily, BJ isnt mad when he finds out. Instead, he shows Riff how to put the plane back together again. Baby Bop is having a great time playing with her homemade boat. However, what she really wants is to ride in a big boat. Barney takes her to look at boats on the computer while BJ and Riff work on a big surprise for her. When Barney and Baby Bop return to the playground, they discover that BJ and Riff have built a sailing ship on the playset for Baby Bop!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop is sad because she lost her pet caterpillar, Monty. Barney and the others try to help her find it. Baby Bop is surprised to discover Monty inside a chrysalis. Everyone is excited to find Monty now a beautiful butterfly! Barney and Baby Bop are thrilled when BJ sets up a bug zoo in the caboose, but Riff isnt so sure he wants to be around bugs. When the park is magically transformed into a amphitheatre with performing insects, Riff discovers that bugs dont bug him after all.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop, BJ and the children prepare for the Shapes Carnival in the park. Riff knows he will do well at the carnival because he is wearing his lucky medal. When he loses the medal, Riff is afraid he wont be able to play the games. With Barneys guidance, Riff has fun playing the games and he realizes he didnt need his lucky medal play and have fun. When it starts to rain at the park, Baby Bop joins Barney and BJ inside the caboose. Baby Bop pokes her head out to see if the rain has stopped and spies a beautiful rainbow in the sky! When the others come to see itits gone. Baby Bop is very disappointed because she liked all the pretty colors, so Barney and the others paint their own life-sized rainbow. When it starts to rain again, the homemade rainbow falls down and gets all wet. Luckily, a real rainbow takes its place!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: An ordinary game of hide and seek takes a not-so-ordinary turn when Baby Bop claims that an elephant is hiding in the park! Barney and Riff are happy to play along, but BJ thinks that his sister may be seeing things. Fortunately, Barney takes this opportunity to help the young dinos learn about their sense of sight while having tons of fun! BJ and Riff engage in a friendly contest to see which of them can find (or make) the loudest sound in the park. The playful competition continues to escalateand along the way, the sounds of animals, musical instruments, and even fire engines are introduced.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Riff has many special qualities, but sometimes, his shyness makes it hard for him to meet new friends. When Barney introduces Riff to some of his friends in the park, its Baby Bop that ends up feeling less-than-special as the kids seem more impressed with Riff and his special talents. Barney helps Baby Bop realize that theres more to being special than the things you can do. The way you feel and the way you make others feel makes you special, too. Its a special day in the park as Barney and the little dinosaurs enjoy an Art Festival. BJ and Riff share some musical art and Baby Bop shares a painting of a very special friendBarney! As the festival comes to an end, Barney reminds his friends everywhere that no matter what kind of art they make, its always special when it comes from their hearts!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When some of the children in the park invite Barney to join them for a race, BJ and Baby Bop decide hell need their help. They show him several ways to get ready for the big race by warming up and stretching. By the end of the day, everyone finds out that there are many fun ways to exercise. When BJ starts to feel sick after eating too many sweets, he lies down in hopes of feeling better. He has a dream about a snack fantasyland where he eats as many sweets as he wants and ends up with a big stomachache. When he wakes up, hes happy to find out it was only a dream. When he asks for a healthy snack, his friends are happy to oblige.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ and Riff find a pirate map, but in order to find the treasure, they have to be able to count. Since Baby Bop has not learned to count yet, Barney offers to help teach her so she can participate. In the end, Baby Bop learns to count and realizes that feeling good about herself is the greatest treasure in the world! Its time for a music concert in the park. As Riff works on his one-man band, the others make posters for the show. Everyone enjoys Riffs calypso rendition of a favorite song, and they all enjoy helping each other.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ learns that having a pet is a much bigger responsibility than he ever expected when he offers to take care of a friends dog. When he accidentally loses the dog, everyone has to work together to find it. When Baby Bops favorite teddy bear is torn, she wants to take him to the veterinarian for help. Barney and Riff pretend to be veterinarians. They show Baby Bop that theres nothing to be afraid of, because doctors and veterinarians are our friends too.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When Baby Bop is surprised by the first day of cold weather, its Barney that helps her see that winter can be a wonderful time for fun. Baby Bop is getting discouraged, wondering if it will ever snow. Then, when she least expects itthe snow begins to fall! On a hot summer day, Barney teaches BJ about all the fun activities you can do during the summer. BJ gets so excited that he corrals Riff into joining him to do a whole summers worth of activities, all in one day! With some help from Baby Bop and the children, Barney teaches BJ that summer means relaxation, too!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Its a very special day at the Parkits Barneys birthday, and there are surprises around every corner. When Barney begins to open his presents, Riff worries that his hand-made gift wont be good enough. In the end, Barney loves Riffs gift and reminds everyone that the best gift of all is one that comes from the heart. Baby Bop is practicing her marching because she will be joining a real marching rhythm band and is having trouble keeping a beat. Barney, BJ and Riff help Baby Bop learn about rhythm just in time for her to join the band.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop has trouble following the rules and taking turns while playing games. Barney and Riff help her learn how to follow the rules and Baby Bop learns that rules make games fun for everyone! BJ hurts his toe while pretending to be Captain Pickles. When Barney suggests he rest in the caboose, BJ becomes frustrated, as hed rather be outside playing. Barney reminds him of the wonderful world of books, and the little dinos decide to write a book of their ownbased on the exciting true-life adventures of Captain Pickles!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJs enthusiastic efforts to decorate the park go awry when he accidentally paints the caboose several different colors. Barney helps BJ learn that everyone makes mistakes. Together with his friends, BJ cleans up the mess he made on the caboose. Baby Bop cant wait for BJ and Riff to go on their camping trip so she can have Barney and the park all to herself! But, once theyre gone, she discovers she misses them more than she expected and the more time that goes by, the more she misses them! Barney shows Baby Bop ways to keep friends close in our hearts while theyre away.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ, Baby Bop and Riff can hardly wait for the petting zoo that is coming to the park. Barney helps them pass the time while teaching them about the days of the week. When the animals finally do arrive, everyone realizes that it was all worth the wait! Riff feels terrible when he accidentally wrecks BJs beloved scooter. BJ loved that scooter more than almost anything! Riff and Baby Bop decide to have a sale in the park to raise money to buy BJ a brand-new scooter.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney and his friends are so excited for a day of play and fun! When a bunch of empty boxes arrived from the Enjoy-Your-Toys Company, their adventure begins. They use their imagination to have the best time ever by transforming the boxes into special toys.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: After playing with Stop and Go signs with Angela, Baby Bop leaves to direct some traffic of her own. Barney and his friends think of other ways to stop and go and discuss reading, especially traffic signs!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney helps his friends put together a Caboose Color Collection which showcases the primary colorsred, yellow and blue. This activity sparks Barney and the kids' imagination, and along with Baby Bop, they realize just how colorful the world can be!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: The children are amazed to find out that playing games and having fun in the park is a great way to exercise. When the rain starts to fall, they use their imagination to come up with clever ways to stay active and have fun indoors.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney and the kids are full of excitement as five of Mr. Boyd's brass-playing friends are planning a special show in the park tonight! Angela is determined to learn the trumpet, but she finds it challenging. To help them get ready for the band's practice, Mr. Boyd introduces the children to various types of horns, making it a fun learning experience!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Meet Colleen, Mr. Boyd's niece! Barney and the kids love having fun together every day but making a brand NEW friend is something extra special! With Barney's help, they all learn how to get to know new friends.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Tony has a box filled with numbers that he made with his dad and is proudly showing them to everyone. Suddenly, a strong gust of wind scatters the numbers all around! Barney and his friends team up to go on an exciting number hunt, helping Tony find and collect his homemade numbers again.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: This Way In! This Way Out!
programme.desc: Angela is in the park to release her turtle, Terry, after observing him with her classmates in school. Barney, Nick, and Sarah are delighted to see Terry come out of his shell, which leads to a discussion about the meanings of in and out. Baby Bop arrives with her chrysalis, and together with Angela's turtle, Barney and his friends are inspired to do In and Out activities.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Its a rainy spring day, and the children can be found inside painting and creating. The weather becomes an exciting opportunity for the kids to learn all about the season of Spring and discuss all the fun activities they can partake in this season. This includes flying a kite, riding a bike, and enjoying the rainbows in the sky.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: After feeling tired of being told to be careful, BJ learns that saying be careful is a way of showing love and concern. This important lesson prompts Barney to teach his friends essential safety rules. Spending time with Barney is always enjoyable, but it's also crucial to learn how to play it safe to stay protected and happy!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney and his friends begin the day by playing hopscotchwith a twist. They discover that making a triangle requires 3 lines and 3 corners, which sparks their excitement to explore more shapes. To have even more triangle fun, Barney takes them on a camping trip where they get to explore and learn about different shapes in the world around them.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Its the day of the bike parade, but Nick has had a bike accident that leaves his bike in need of repair by Mr. Boyd. Mr. Boyd works quickly to help fix Nick's bike in time for the parade. While waiting, Barney takes the opportunity to teach his friends all about bike safety, making sure they're ready to ride safely and have a great time in the parade!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: After the kids discuss their desire for a special day, Beth creates Happy Day, a special holiday in which each friend makes a wish and the others try to make it come true. When Beth hurts herself, BJ learns the importance of doing good deeds for others.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney plans a magical picnic for his friends and their families to spend quality time together and create lasting memories. Each kid has brought a family treasure to show Barney, which they all excitedly spend time sharing with one another.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: The kids gather at the park, talking about how hot it is and wondering what to do on such a day. Thanks to Barney's brilliant idea, what starts as a too hot afternoon turns into a totally cool day as he introduces them to the wonders of water. Excitedly, they all team up to find creative ways to stay cool and have a splashing good time together!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Even though the park feels like a second home for Barney and his friends, BJ dreams of building his very own totally awesome, completely cool house. While they eagerly wait to see it, they start talking about the different rooms a house can have. However, when BJ forgets to include a space for Baby Bop in his plans, Barney reminds him that family is what truly makes a house feel like a home.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When some of the children invite Barney to join them for a race, BJ and Baby Bop decide hell need their help. By the end of the day, everyone finds out that there are many fun ways to exercise. Baby Bop cant wait for BJ and Riff to go on their camping trip so she can have Barney and the park all to herself! But, once theyre gone, she discovers that as more time that goes by, the more she misses them!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney is snacking on pistachios...and just can't seem to stop! His friends try to help. An unexpected avalanche of pistachios convinces Barney that his friends may be right. BJ has a dream after eating too many sweets, where he eats as many sweets as he wants and ends up with a big stomachache. When he wakes up, hes happy to find out it was only a dream. When he asks for a healthy snack, his friends are happy to oblige.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When Baby Bop becomes a little bossy playing with her friends, Barney teaches her that being bossy isn't a nice way to treat your friends. Riff feels terrible when he accidentally wrecks BJs beloved scooter. BJ loved that scooter more than almost anything! Riff and Baby Bop decide to have a sale in the park to raise money to buy BJ a brand-new scooter.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop is having a hard time finding a story she hasn't heard before. Barney and the dinos decide to tell her an old story with a new twist...by singing Little Red Riding Hood! When a wheelchair-bound child is unintentionally neglected by his friends, Barney steps in to help. He reminds the others to include the child by showing them that even Barney feels excluded sometimes. In the end, everyone is included for a day of fun!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop is sad because she lost her pet caterpillar, Monty. Barney and the others try to help her find it. Baby Bop is surprised to discover Monty inside a chrysalis. Everyone is excited to find Monty now a beautiful butterfly! Rachel carelessly litters in the park then later has a dream about animals who talk. With Barney and the animals help, Rachel learns that the park is home to many. Rachel realizes the importance of nature and of keeping our earth clean!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ receives a letter from his pen pal in China revealing that his pen pal will be coming to visit. With the help of friends, BJ hurries to get the park ready. He wants it decorated so his pen pal feels right at home. BJ soon learns that his pen pal wants to see how BJ really lives. Barney has a tee-rific surprise for BJ and Baby Bop. Cousin Riff is moving to town!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ is pretending to be a great detective and a case quickly comes his way when something nibbles on one of Baby Bops healthy snacks. BJ, Barney, and Baby Bop uncover several clues along the way and soon realize the culprit is a pet rabbit. When Riff hears a mysterious sound in the park, he plays detective. Along the way, they explore the sense of sound while identifying sounds of nature and the neighborhood.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop wants everyone to play with her instead of working in their garden. They promise to play with her as soon as they finish. Baby Bop can't wait, and tries many ways to get them to come play with her now. When her friends do come to play, they have a tea party and enjoy some of the fresh things from the garden. Riff invents a Happiness Machine to try to cheer up a sad little girl. But it's her friends, not the machine, that make her happy!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Everyone loves Barney! When Ryan tries to be just like Barney, he has a hard time filling Barney's shoes. Ryan soon learns that he is special when he's just being himself! Barney's friends are having a hard time deciding what to do because everyone wants to do the same thing! Barney's Native American tale, The Chase, shows them that it's best to think for themselves and not follow the crowd.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney and Riff help Baby Bop learn how to follow the rules and learn that rules make games fun for everyone! Baby Bop is having one of those days! Every time she turns around, someone is telling her no! As her frustration grows, Barney explains that the word no can help you avoid making mistakes or getting hurt.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: The Emperor's Contest | The Whole Truth
programme.desc: There's a fishing contest in the park! When Ryan is tempted not to follow the rules, Barney tells The Emperor's Contest and Ryan discovers that honesty is the best policy. A talented young artist is painting a portrait of Barney, but when she steps away, BJ takes credit for it. When the others beg him to teach them to paint, BJ admits the truth and learns that honesty is the best policy!
